CheckTitle: All virtual machines in the subscription have system updates applied
Description:
**Azure VMs** are evaluated for:
- Presence of a monitoring agent
- Periodic checks for missing updates
- Installation of the latest **security and critical OS updates** on Windows and Linux
Risk: Unpatched VMs are exposed to **known exploits** (RCE, privilege escalation), enabling **initial access** and **lateral movement**. This endangers **confidentiality** (data theft), **integrity** (tampering), and **availability** (ransomware, outages). Lapses in periodic assessment prolong exposure to critical vulnerabilities.

Code.Other:
1. In the Azure portal, go to Microsoft Defender for Cloud > Recommendations
2. Search for "Log Analytics agent should be installed on virtual machines"
   - Select affected VMs > Fix > choose a Log Analytics workspace > Apply
3. Search for "Machines should be configured to periodically check for missing system updates"
   - Select affected VMs > Fix > Apply
4. Search for "System updates should be installed on your machines" (may show as powered by Azure Update Manager)
   - Select affected VMs > Fix > Install updates now (or One-time update) > Install
5. Wait for installation to complete, then verify all three recommendations show Healthy for the subscription

Recommendation.Text:
Adopt **automated patching** for all VMs:
- Schedule recurring assessments
- Deploy security/critical updates promptly using maintenance windows and rings
- Ensure a supported update/monitoring agent
- Enforce risk-based SLAs, test in stages, keep backups, and use **least privilege** for patch tools

Notes: Running Microsoft Defender for Cloud incurs additional charges for each resource monitored. Please see attached reference for exact charges per hour.
